data.title: [TRACKER] Plugin system related issues
data.body:
### This is the tracker for specific issues related to Godot plugin system:
- [x] Get_local_mouse_pos() offset bug in the editor https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/1885 (bug)
- [x] Editor not removing name from menu https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5754 (bug)
- [x] Editor hangs - caused by EditorSelection https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6244 (bug)
- [x] Add a API to add/remove items to the "Tools" menu https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/6065 (enhancement)
- [x] EditorPlugins for main editors need a way to know the "main screen" parent https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5786 (enhancement)
- [x] Ability to open given scene in editor https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6495 (enhancement)
- [x] Ability to access editor 3d camera in tool mode https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6869 (enhancement)
- [ ] Error instancing scene as editor tool https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6006 (bug) 
- [ ] Plugin reload doesn't keeps variables https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5969 (bug)
- [ ] Expose CanvasItemEditor and SpatialEditor to GDScript https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3992 (enhancement)
- [ ] Ability to refresh editor Filesystem tree from plugin https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6219 (enhancement)
- [ ] Ability for plugins to add entry under right mouse click context menu  https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6128 (enhancement)
- [ ] Ability to create plugin that is based on a scene https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3895 (enhancement)
- [ ] No way to edit plugin.cfg in editor https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5096 (enhancement)
- [ ] Text editor extensions https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3869 (enhancement)
- [ ] Ability to encapsulate tool subscenes (New ways of using tool keyword) https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/8735 (enhancement)
- [ ] Expose EditorNode to plugins https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6520 (enhancement)

### Couple others more wide issues:
- [ ] _Reduz_: Editor Plugin Ideas, Improvements, Suggestions https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6254
- [ ] _TheHX_: Suggestions for the Plugin API  https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4276
- [ ] _Zatherz_: Better custom EditorPlugin nodes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6067
- [ ] _Kubecz3k:_ EditorPlugin ability to determine current editor state https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6497

data.title: Godot Editor Crash When Typing Certain Code in the Script Editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS: Windows 10 Home on a x86 system with a GTX 780
Version: Godot 2.1.stable.official (Through Steam)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The Godot Editor crashes when you declare a variable then set it equal to itself and try to access a member variable with the . operator (I did it by accident, I swear!)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1: In a script (either existing or new; save your work before doing it!), type in var something = something. (note that the period must be there)
Example:

var crashme = crashme.

2: As soon as you type that, instant crash!

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
This happens even with a brand new project with nothing new in it.

data.title: Error in browser "_as_voices[$0] is undefined"
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OpenSuse Leap 42.1 64 bit
Godot 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

The repo for the game is https://gitlab.com/zombiesgo/zombiesgo.gitlab.io.  I the middle of playing it, I get a popup saying, "Exception thrown, see JavaScript console".  The console shows:

TypeError: _as_voices[$0] is null
ASM_CONSTS</_as_voices[$0].onended()

[post-exception status] Exception thrown, see JavaScript consolezombiesgo.gitlab.io:331:7
printErr()zombiesgo.gitlab.io:331
window.onerror/Module.setStatus()zombiesgo.gitlab.io:350
window.onerror()zombiesgo.gitlab.io:348

TypeError: _as_voices[$0] is undefined
ASM_CONSTS</_as_voices[$0].onended()

**Steps to reproduce:**
Start playing the game at any level of difficulty, and the error should show within a minute of gameplay.  It seems to be related to a mouseclick. The link to the game is https://zombiesgo.gitlab.io/.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: The profiler doesn't works when vsync is disabled
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1, Windows 10 64 bits

When vsync is disabled, running the profiler results in weird behaviour.
The graph shows vertical lines, and most of the timing info is missing in the left panel. Sometimes it appears for one frame or two, but quickly disappear.
Clicking in the graph often makes the game to freeze and suspend the profiling session.

When vsync is enabled, the profiler works fine, however if I click in the graph, the line where I clicked seems to move and shift at a different rate than the graph.

Related thread on Q/A: https://godotengine.org/qa/7242/how-to-use-the-profiler?show=7242#q7242

data.title: Godot Engine Editor has stopped working
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
 Windows 7 Home Premium 64 bit with Service Pack 1
3.0GB RAM
AMD Athalon DualCore processor 5400B 2.80Ghz
Godot version: Godot_v2.1-stable_win64
AND                 Godot_v2.1-stable_win32

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
After download and extract of Godot on my computer, double clicking on the executable 
A window opens with the following:

  EXEC PATHP??: C:\Users\Roger\godot\2.1 Install\Godot_v2.1-stable_win64.exe
  EXEC PATHP??: C:\Users\Roger\godot\2.1 Install\Godot_v2.1-stable_win64.exe
  EXEC PATHP??: C:\Users\Roger\godot\2.1 Install\Godot_v2.1-stable_win64.exe
  DETECTED MONITORS: 1

A blank window with a white background opens partially covering the first window

A smaller window opens in the middle of the white window with the following text:
  Godot engine editor has stopped working
  A problem caused the program to stop working correctly.
  Windows will close the program and notify you if a solution is available.

A button [Close program] is displayed on the window.  Clicking the Close program button closes all 3 windows.  

Changing Windows compatibility choices or downloading and running the 32 bit version also present the same error.

**Steps to reproduce:**
As noted above  

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Not applicable.

data.title: Ask user to create a path if it doesn't exist
data.body:
Whenever a user is prompted to pick a path, if they type a path that doesn't exist, godot should offer to create the path for the user.

Currently, if the path doesn't exist godot simply says "the path must exist" and doesn't allow you to proceed.

![godot-issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1817000/17942033/b7335c72-6a03-11e6-9c8e-225acd76ab7e.png)

The above example comes from the project manager, however, this issue appears in the import plugins as well. 

IMO there should be a popup asking the user to confirm if they would like to create the directory.

data.title: Matrix32: Add a constructor which takes six real_t params
data.body: This constructor would save me a few lines and Matrix3 already has one so why not?

data.title: DocData: Fix null reference not detected correctly
data.body: Now `DEFVAL(Ref<Type>())` will be translated as `NULL` in the docs instead of `Object()`, so using `DEFVAL(Variant())` instead won't be needed any more.

data.title: GDScript should allow linebreaks inside function calls
data.body:
This produces a syntax error, at least in the editor ("Error parsing expression, misplaced: '\n'"):

```
return Vector2(
    x, y)
```

This works fine:

```
return (Vector2(
    x, y))
```

It looks like newlines are ignores within free parentheses, but not within the parentheses used for a function call.  Python allows either.

data.title: A MeshInstance2D node
data.body:
Basically there is no way to use OpenGL primitives in 2D, while in 3D you can use the SurfaceTool and a MeshInstance. Polygon2D is limited (still it is useful), and it also assumes edges do not intersect with eachother (also you can't render with PRIMITIVE_LINE_STRIP for example).

2D Meshes might make use of the Z coordinate, so basically only a MeshInstance2D would be needed (SurfaceTool, MeshDataTool could stay the same).

Thoughts?

data.title: Editor layout reset discrepancy
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.2, Win 10 x64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Picking _Settings -> Editor Layout -> Default_ doesn't provide the actual default layout when a blank project is created.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a new project.
2. Pick _Settings -> Editor Layout -> Default_.
3. Note how the layout has changed although it should stay the same.

data.title: Code draws are broken by 2D stretching.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Fedora 24 - 64 Bits. Godot 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

What happened: The draw was broken.
What was expected: The draw was not broken.

**Steps to reproduce:**
[gradient.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/433948/gradient.tar.gz)
1. Set, Project Settings > Display > strech_mode : ON, 2d.
2. Set, Project Settings > Display > strech_aspect : ON, keep.
3. Draw something by code.
4. Resize the windows.

data.title: 3D KinematicBody doesn't use collision exceptions.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Using `A.add_collision_exception_with(B)` where A or B is a KinematicBody wont work. The bodies will still collide. It doesn't matter what the other PhysicsBody is, as long as one of them is a KinematicBody.

data.title: Offer basic geographic projection conversion LatLng2Vec2 (mercator example)
Prevent to add node to selection when node is not inside tree
A way to know in-editor if sub-resources are unique or not
data.body:
Hi, if you duplicate for example an AnimationPlayer its sub-resources remain linked and on the editor there is no way to determine if the sub-resources are unique or not. The only way now is to check the .tscn file.
So I was thinking that perhaps a good solution for this would be to show the list of sub-resources ids used by the node on the Inspector, I could try to implement this as well but I would like to know first if you agree with this or not :)

data.title: add NetworkedMultiplayerENet::set_bind_ip
data.body:
which allows ENet to bind on custom IP.

fix #6248

data.title: Tilemap / Tileset Area2D vs StaticBody2D for detecting presence of object on tiles
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** v2.1.stable.official

I tried doing a `TileSet` with an `Area2D` as a tile and it seems that the collision shape isn't saved when converting the scene to `TileSet`. Now, I know you can have a `StaticBody2D` with a `CollishionShape2D` that has `Trigger` set to `On`, but I think it would make much more sense to be able to have a tile with an `Area2D`, which I guess it isn't possible now? Or am I missing something? You may want to have tiles which trigger certain events but don't block player / enemy movement for example so in this cases it would make sense to have `Area2D`. I'm sure this isn't a big deal but it would be a nice feature to have since this is exactly what `Area2D` is supposed to do (among other things)... unless I'm missing something obvious :)

data.title: AnimationPlayer duplication issue
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Latest godot v2.2 on github

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Whenever you duplicate an AnimationPlayer node it doesn't duplicates as well its animations and they stay linked in both nodes, I was expecting that the animations get duplicated as well so that if I change the animations on the duplicated node it won't change the animations on the original one.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Duplicate any AnimationPlayer node.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
I can provide one if needed but I guess it's not.

data.title: Editor Plugin Ideas, Improvements, Suggestions, etc. Issue.
data.body:
The Editor plugin API in Godot was mostly done with wishful thinking, and as a way to have a stable and clean API to editor functions (which may vary over time internally, or are not clean enough). 

However, I'm positive that a lot of functionality for what you can do in the editor is missing from this API, thus inaccessible for plugins. 

This issue is for you to write what kind of functions, objects, functionalities, etc. are missing for you, or you would like to be able to access so we add them in the next Godot version.

Feedback very welcome!

data.title: debug_print option for printing stuff to the debugger window?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS is N/A, Godot version? 2.0 and up I guess.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Inspired by https://twitter.com/ProbDenis/status/741981375604137984 - when running a game in debug mode (be it in the editor or using a debug-enabled export option), it'd be nice to have a print_debug command (or similar), so that certain types of messages don't get printed in a release game (if run from terminal or whatnot).

Functionally it should be identical to print as-is, other than it not printing to stdout but stderr.

data.title: no "IP" argument for Networking API
data.body:
There is no option to set IP in `create_server` in `NetworkedMultiplayerPeer`.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/modules/enet/networked_multiplayer_enet.h#L79

I've worked as sysadmin and servers with mutiple IPs (often FailOver IPs that can be rerouted to another server in matter of seconds) are really common.

And then comes this software than doesn't give you option to choose IP and screws your whole server....

data.title: [Script Editor] Allow scrolling past code
data.body:
Allowing the user to scroll past the code to give space between the end of code and the bottom of the Godot window would help a lot. This would stop the user from having to look at the very bottom of their screen in order to write script at the very bottom of their file. SublimeText has this feature and I've included a screenshot of it to show what I mean.

![sublimescreen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1102632/17871909/646c6604-6883-11e6-86e2-ca576c6abd65.png)

As it stands right now, the script editor in Godot does not allow you to scroll past the final line of code being placed on the final line of the editor. SublimeText handles this feature the best way I've seen and it would be great if Godot could reproduce it. ST allows the user to scroll completely past the code all the way down until the final line of code has reached the top line of the editor.

This feature can be worked around right now by just creating a bunch of empty lines at the end of the code but that just feels sloppy and it would be nice if that didn't need to be done.
